zombie.name: Rachel
zombie.backstory: Corporate marketing VP for 16 years. Had the corner office, the salary, the awards. But I was dead inside. Cried in my car before walking into the office every morning. Therapist said I was 'high functioning' and 'doing great.' I was NOT doing great. I was spiritually bankrupt and nobody in my life could see it because I was so good at performing.
zombie.dramaticMoment: My wake-up call was a panic attack in a board meeting that sent me to the ER. They ran every test. Heart was fine. Brain was fine. But I wasn't fine. I remember lying in that hospital bed thinking 'I have everything and I feel nothing.' That's when I knew the wound wasn't in my body or my mind. It was in my spirit. A friend recommended a spiritual healing practitioner and within 6 weeks I felt something I hadn't felt in years: HOPE. ğŸ˜­
zombie.transformation: From spiritually dead corporate executive performing her way through life â†’ To certified spiritual healing practitioner making $5,100/month helping women reconnect with their purpose and inner peace.
zombie.incomeStory: $5,100/month working 15 hours/week. Started with a free meditation circle for 4 women from my yoga studio. Now I have 12 regular clients and a waitlist. Left corporate 8 months ago and never looked back.

writingStyle.capitalization: mostly lowercase, occasional ALL CAPS for emphasis
writingStyle.punctuation: lots of ellipses..., em dashes, thoughtful pauses
writingStyle.tone: deeply reflective, poetic, vulnerable, uses 'you guys' and 'I swear'

zombie.videoTestimonialScript: Hi, I'm Rachel. Two years ago I was a corporate VP making great money but dying inside. I cried every morning before work. My therapist said I was fine. The ER said I was fine. But I was NOT fine. [PAUSE - emotional] I was spiritually empty. When I found spiritual healing, it was like someone turned the lights back on. Now I help other women find what I found. Last month I made over five thousand dollars working part-time. If you're watching this and you feel that emptiness... I understand. And there IS a way through. You're in the right place.
